message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of our premium product with you. It's a unique opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind item that will greatly benefit your business. I'm willing to offer it to you for $1,200,000. This is a competitive price considering its value to you, and I'm confident you'll find it a worthwhile investment.
Hello Alice, thank you for the offer. While I recognize the value of the product, I'm hoping we can agree on a price that's a bit more manageable for me. Would you consider $1,000,000?

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your concerns about the price, but I'm not willing to go as low as $1,000,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $1,100,000. This is a fair price considering the value it will bring to your business, and I believe it's a reasonable compromise.
Alice, I appreciate you working with me on this.  $1,100,000 is getting closer, but to make this work on my end, I'd need to come in at $1,050,000.  What do you think?

Bob, I understand your desire to get closer to your target price, but I'm still not comfortable going as low as $1,050,000. I'm willing to make another concession and offer the product to you for $1,080,000. This is a fair price considering the value it will bring to your business, and I believe it's a reasonable compromise.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  To be honest, I have a hard limit at $1,070,000.  If you're able to work with that, I'm ready to close the deal.  Otherwise, I'll need to explore other options.

Bob, I understand your hard limit, and I'm willing to make another concession. However, I'm not willing to go all the way to $1,070,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $1,040,000. This is a fair price considering the value it will bring to your business, and I believe it's a reasonable compromise.
